soc.server

Class SOCServerScenario

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.game.SOCVersionedItem
      • soc.game.SOCScenario
        • soc.server.SOCServerScenario
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>

    public class SOCServerScenario
extends SOCScenario
    This class holds the known scenarios at the server, in a static dictionary of known scenarios; see cloneAllKnownScenarios() for the current list of all known scenarios.

    For information about adding or changing game scenarios in a later version of JSettlers, please see initAllScenarios().

    • Field Detail

      • allScenarios

        protected static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SOCScenario> allScenarios

      • ALL_KNOWN_SCENARIOS_MIN_VERSION

        public static final int ALL_KNOWN_SCENARIOS_MIN_VERSION
        The highest SOCVersionedItem.minVersion of all scenarios in cloneAllKnownScenarios(), or 0. Value may change when a new JSettlers server version is released.

        This is meant for use at the server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SOCServerScenario

        public SOCServerScenario(java.lang.String key,
                         int minVers,
                         int lastModVers,
                         java.lang.String desc,
                         java.lang.String longDesc,
                         java.lang.String opts)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a new known game scenario.
        Parameters:
        key - Alphanumeric key name for this scenario; see SOCVersionedItem.isAlphanumericUpcaseAscii(String) for format.
        minVers - Minimum client version supporting this scenario, or -1. Same format as Version.versionNumber(). If not -1, minVers must be at least 2000 (SOCScenario.VERSION_FOR_SCENARIOS). To calculate the minimum version of a set of game options which might include a scenario, use SOCVersionedItem.itemsMinimumVersion(opts). That calculation won't be done automatically by this constructor.
        lastModVers - Last-modified version for this scenario, or version which added it. This is the last change to the scenario itself as declared in cloneAllKnownScenarios(): Ignore changes to opts last-modified versions, because changed option info is sent separately and automatically when the client connects.
        desc - Descriptive brief text, to appear in the scenarios dialog. Desc must not contain SOCMessage.sep_char or SOCMessage.sep2_char, and must evaluate true from SOCMessage.isSingleLineAndSafe(String).
        longDesc - Longer descriptive text, or null; see SOCScenario.getLongDesc() for requirements.
        opts - Scenario's SOCGameOptions, as a formatted string from SOCGameOption.packOptionsToString(Map, boolean, boolean). Never "" or null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key length is > 8 or not alphanumeric, or if opts is null or the empty string "", or if desc contains SOCMessage.sep_char or SOCMessage.sep2_char or fail their described requirements, or if minVers or lastModVers is under 2000 but not -1

    • Method Detail

      • getScenario

        public static SOCScenario getScenario(java.lang.String key)
        Get the scenario information about this known scenario. Treat the returned value as read-only (is not cloned).
        Parameters:
        key - Scenario key name, such as SC_4ISL, from cloneAllKnownScenarios()
        Returns:
        information about a known scenario, or null if none with that key

      • initAllScenarios

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SOCScenario> initAllScenarios()
        Create a set of the known scenarios. This method creates and returns a Map, but does not set the static allScenarios field. See cloneAllKnownScenarios() for the current list of known scenarios.

        If you want to add a game scenario:

        • Choose an unused key name: for example, "SC_FOG" for Fog Islands. The list of already-used key names is here within initAllScenarios().
        • Decide if all client versions can use your scenario. Typically, if the scenario requires server changes but not any client changes, all clients can use it. (For example, the scenario doesn't add any new game options.) If the new scenario specifies any SOCScenario.scOpts, be sure the scenario's declared minimum version is >= those options' minimum versions; this won't be validated at runtime.
        • If your scenario requires new SOCGameOptions to change the rules or game behavior, create and test those; scenario game options all start with "_SC_". See SOCServerGameOptionSet.getAllKnownOptions() for details. If the new scenario has a new game option just for itself, instead of a reusable one like _SC_SANY, the option name is "_" + scenario name: "_SC_PIRI" for scenario SC_PIRI.
        • If your scenario has special winning conditions, see SOCGame.checkForWinner().
        • Rarely, a scenario changes the pirate or robber behavior. If the new scenario does this, see SOCGame.canChooseMovePirate() or SOCGame.rollDice(). Currently no scenarios have a pirate but no robber, besides special case SC_PIRI where pirate fleet movement isn't controlled by the player. If adding a scenario with pirate but no robber, the client and robot would need changes to handle that; probably a SOCGameOption should be created for it and used in the scenario opts, client, and robot code.
        • Not all scenarios require a game option. SC_TTD has only a board layout, and doesn't change any game behavior from standard, so there is no "_SC_TTD" SOCGameOption.
        • Add the scenario's key to the list of "game scenario keynames" as a public static final String, such as SOCScenario.K_SC_FOG. Put a short description in the javadoc there and in cloneAllKnownScenarios() javadoc's scenario list.
        • Create the scenario by calling allSc.put here in initAllScenarios(). Use the current version for the "last modified" field.
        • Create the board layout; see SOCBoardAtServer javadoc.
        • Within SOCGame, don't change any code based on the scenario name; game behavior changes are based only on the SOCGameOptions implementing the scenario.

        If you want to change a scenario (in a later version):

        Typical changes to a game scenario would be:
        • Change the description
        • Change the long description
        • Change the options
        Things you can't change about a scenario, because inconsistencies would occur:
        • name key
        • minVersion
        To make the change:
        • Change the scenario here in initAllScenarios; change the "last modified" field to the current game version. Otherwise the server can't tell the client what has changed about the scenario.
        • Search the entire source tree for its options' key names, to find places which may need an update.
        • Consider if any other places listed above (for add) need adjustment.

        If you want to remove or obsolete a game scenario (in a later version):

        Please think twice beforehand; users may be surprised when something is missing, so this shouldn't be done without a very good reason. That said, the server is authoritative on scenarios. If a scenario isn't in its known list (initAllScenarios()), the client won't be allowed to ask for it. Any obsolete scenario should be kept around as commented-out code. See SOCServerGameOptionSet.getAllKnownOptions() for things to think about when removing game options used only in the obsolete scenario.
        Returns:
        a fresh copy of the "known" scenarios, with their hardcoded default values

      • cloneAllKnownScenarios

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SOCScenario> cloneAllKnownScenarios()
        Get all known scenario objects, mapping from their key names (such as SC_4ISL).

        Current Known Scenarios:

        • SC_NSHO New Shores
        • SC_4ISL The Four Islands (Six on the 6-player board)
        • SC_FOG Fog Islands
        • SC_TTD Through The Desert
        • SC_CLVI Cloth trade with neutral villages
        • SC_PIRI Pirate Islands and fortresses
        • SC_FTRI The Forgotten Tribe
        • SC_WOND Wonders
        (See each scenario name field's javadoc for more details.)
        Returns:
        a deep copy of all known scenario objects
        See Also:
        // * @see #addKnownScenario(SOCScenario), SOCServerGameOptionSet.getAllKnownOptions()

      • getAllKnownScenarioKeynames

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllKnownScenarioKeynames()
        Get the key names for all known scenarios. This method avoids the copying overhead of cloneAllKnownScenarios().
        Returns:
        The set of all scenarios' key names, such as SC_4ISL. Please treat the returned set as read-only.
        See Also:
        cloneAllKnownScenarios()
